etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Journal of the Chemical Society. From chalco- + -one, after German Chalkon, with allusion to the copper colour of the compound

definitions: A pale yellow crystalline ketone, 1,3-diphenyl-2-propen-1-one, C₆ H₅ CH=CHC(O)·C₆ H₅. More widely: any of a large class of ketones which are substituted derivatives of this and include many hydroxylated compounds involved in the synthesis of flavonoids by plants.
